A new version of a 2022 bill that recognises the legal rights of the largest freshwater ecosystem in the world has been introduced! The Great Lakes provide water for 40 million people in the USA and Canada but sadly, they’re plagued by sewage, industrial waste, plastic pollution and toxic algae blooms.

If made law, the Great Lakes and State Waters Bill of Rights will recognise the legal rights of these vital bodies of water to “exist, persist, flourish, naturally evolve, regenerate and be restored”.

The latest version takes on board feedback from local communities and expands protection to all NY State waters. It includes treaty rights protections for Indigenous Peoples and Tribal Nations and empowers counties and municipalities to enact Rights of Nature laws.

As the Rights of Nature movement grows, US communities continue to campaign to recognise Nature’s rights. The introduction of this bill at state level represents an important moment for this grassroots movement for change. 💦🍃🌍
